page.title: 17FARMING LOCAL SURVEY 1
page.content:
{There are 11 farms to be found in {our study area. 7 farms are dairy {farms, 5 grow some arable crops. 2 {raise beef cattle , 2 have sheep and {1 raises mainly pigs.
I intervewed some of the farmers:_ {Napley Lodge}dairy farm has 100 friesian cows producing on average 1720 litres per year. They use a 'Herring-bone'parlour with pit, pumping milk into a bulk tank. Cattle are kept inside in winter and fed on silage and concentrates. Because of E.E.C milk quotas more silage is having to be made in 1985 to save money on buying concentrates.
